intro: Dorstenia, commonly known as the "arrowhead plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, the Americas, and Asia. The plants are characterized by their unique, often spiraling inflorescences and their ability to produce a milky latex. Many species are grown as ornamental plants due to their striking foliage and interesting growth habits. Dorstenia species typically thrive in moist, well-drained soil and require partial shade to full sun depending on the species.
